summary: Gale Lynn Oppenberg was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). Her name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, annual salary, and gross pay during her employment with the committee. The documents indicate her continued employment with the SCAS throughout the specified period.
significance: Gale Lynn Oppenberg's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. As an employee, she was part of the team investigating the JFK assassination, and her presence on payroll records provides a verifiable detail of the committee's staffing and operations during its investigation.
